lead_paragraph: The Japanese have taken another hard blow in their defeat at Milne Bay. Their landing was an attempt to retrieve in part their expulsion from Tulagi by establishing a new bridgehead for a two-way offensive against Port Moresby and eventually Australia itself. Now that they have been driven into the sea they have lost the initiative in the New Guinea area and the waters that wash its eastern shore.
